Package com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.exceptions

This package contains all Exceptions that may be thrown at different times within NetCom2.

See: Description

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ClientConnectionFailedException
    This Exception signals that the internal creation of an Client, based upon a Socket, failed.
    ClientCreationFailedException
    This Exception is thrown, if the AbstractConnection.setup method encounters an Exception This means, that the Socket's OutputStream used for the SendingService is faulty or not connected.
    CommunicationNotSpecifiedException
    This Exception signals that the CommunicationRegistration has no provided OnReceive provided for the provided Class.
    ConnectionCreationFailedException
    This Exception will be thrown if the creation of the Connection failed.
    DeSerializationFailedException
    This Exception shows that the deserialization of some Object failed.
    HandlerInvocationException
    This Exception will be thrown if anything goes wrong within the RemoteObjectRegistration.
    NetComException
    This Exception is the super-Exception for any non-runtime Exception within NetCom2.
    NetComRuntimeException
    Any Exception, that is not declared in any interface within NetCom2 is a sub-class of this Exception.
    NoCorrectHandlerFoundException
    This RuntimeException will be thrown, if you call ReceivePipeline.to(Object), but no Method, annotated with ReceiveHandler was found, which returned true on ReceiveHandler.active()
    PipelineAccessException
    This Exception will be thrown if you illegally Access an ReceivePipeline.
    RemoteObjectInvalidMethodException
    This Exception will be thrown, if the RemoteObjectRegistration receives a RemoteAccessCommunicationRequest with a declared method, that the defined class does not have.
    RemoteObjectNotRegisteredException
    This Exception will be thrown, if no Object is registered for the requested Class inside the RMI API.
    RemoteRequestException
    This Exception-type is thrown, whenever an RMI request failed for any reason.
    SendFailedException
    This RuntimeException, will be thrown, if any Object-send fails for any reason.
    SerializationFailedException
    This Exception will be thrown if Serialization fails.
    SetupListenerException
    This RuntimeException will be thrown, if any Connection entry or exit point fails to be setUp.
    StartFailedException
    This Exception will be thrown, if the Start of the ServerStart or the ClientStart fails.
    UnRegistrationException
    This Exception will be thrown, if you try to call Sender.unRegistrationToServer(Class) on a class you have never registered.

Package com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.exceptions Description

This package contains all Exceptions that may be thrown at different times within NetCom2.

You should not attempt to create your own Exception outside of NetCom2. Those Exceptions are meant to signal the using developer, that NetCom2 internally encountered an Exception.

Since:
1.0
